entry.def: A federal country or system of government is one in which the different states or provinces of the country have important powers to make their own laws and decisions.

example.ex: Five of the six provinces are to become autonomous regions in a new federal system of government.
example.tran: 在新的联邦政府体制中，6 省中的 5 个将成为自治区。

entry.def: Some people use federal to describe a system of government which they disapprove of, in which the different states or provinces are controlled by a strong central government.
entry.tran: 中央集权式的;集权式联邦制的

example.ex: He does not believe in a federal Europe with centralising powers.
example.tran: 他认为一个集权式联邦制在欧洲是不可行的。

entry.def: Federal also means belonging or relating to the national government of a federal country rather than to one of the states within it.
entry.tran: 归属联邦政府的;与联邦政府有关的

example.ex: The federal government controls just 6% of the education budget.
example.tran: 联邦政府仅掌控 6％的教育预算。

means.word_mean: 1. national; especially in reference to the government of the United States as distinct from that of its member units;
2. of or relating to the central government of a federation;

sentences.sentence: "a federal district is one set aside as the seat of the national government"

means.word_mean: 3. characterized by or constituting a form of government in which power is divided between one central and several regional authorities;

sentences.sentence: "a federal system like that of the United States"
"federal governments often evolved out of confederatons"
